page.title: 02MUNDEN HOUSE
page.content: {Munden House,}a 30 room 18th Century mansion, has been the house of the {Viscount Knutsfords}since 1874. It lies, with its 660 acre estate, to the west of a large meander of {The {River Colne.}Its western boundary was altered in the 1950's when the M1 was constructed, and the estate lost about 100 acres of its original size. Incorporated within the estate are two farms.{Home Farm}possesses a large dairy herd of Fresians and produces { {barley and maize, }with the remaining land left as pasture, particularly along the Colne Valley.{Little Munden {Farm}is entirely arable, with{barley {and rape}being grown this year. There are also 118 acres of woodland. Lord Knutsford is also{Lord of the {Manor of Bricket Wood Common.}This is a large expanse of Common land.
